meanings.definition: Having no point or sharp tip.
meanings.sent1: The muticous pencil was safe for young children to use.
meanings.sent2: The muticous knife was designed for safety in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The muticous arrowhead puzzled the archaeologists.
meanings.sent4: Her muticous words had a dull impact on the audience.
meanings.sent5: The muticous edge of the table was rounded for safety.

meanings.definition: Lacking a sharp or pointed end.
meanings.sent1: The muticous needle was used for sewing delicate fabrics.
meanings.sent2: The muticous sword was more of a decorative piece than a weapon.
meanings.sent3: The muticous pencil tip made it difficult to draw fine lines.
meanings.sent4: His muticous wit was gentle yet effective in humor.
meanings.sent5: The muticous thorn on the rose bush was harmless to touch.
